U.S. Neo-liberalism Rebuffed in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Neo-liberalism Rebuffed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The participants in a meeting of youth and students held in Seoul on April 30 to vow to intensify their actions voiced opposition to neo-liberalism imposed upon south Korea by the United States, asserting that the vital rights of the workers in this land are threatened by the U.S. moves for neo-liberalism, the south Korean MBC reported.
 They demanded the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop at once the negotiations for the conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" and withdraw their plan for the expansion of the U.S. military base.
 At the end of the meeting its participants burned the stars and stripes, while staging a demonstration.

North Side Sends Telephone Message to South Side
articles.content:
North Side Sends Telephone Message to South Side 
    Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The head of the north side to the inter-Korean ministerial talks Friday sent a telephone message to the chief delegate of the south side proposing a working contact between officials concerned of the two sides to discuss the issue of Pyongyang visit by Kim Dae Jung, former president of south Korea.
 The message said that the north side suggested having the above-said contact at Mt. Kumgang resort on May 16 and it would send to the contact four officials headed by Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee.

Ninth Pyongyang Spring International Commodity Exhibition to Be Held
articles.content:
Ninth Pyongyang Spring International Commodity Exhibition to Be Held 
    Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The Ninth Pyongyang Spring International Commodity Exhibition will be held in the DPRK from May 15 to 18 under the sponsorship of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation.
 It will be participated in by more than 200 companies from ten-odd countries and regions including the DPRK, China, Syria, Thailand, Sweden, France, Czech Republic, Switzerland, Germany, Italy and Taipei of China.    
 On display there will be various kinds of steel products, machine tools, poultry equipment, medicines, agricultural chemicals and chemical fertilizer, petroleum and chemical goods, electric and electronic goods, foodstuffs, daily necessities and other items.    
 During the exhibition companies may have wide-range contacts and trade talks with each other.
 The Pyongyang international commodity exhibition is held in spring and autumn every year. 
 The first Pyongyang Autumn International Commodity Exhibition was held in October last year.

Congratulations to Nepalese Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Nepalese Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Girija Prasad Koirala on his appointment as prime minister of the government of the Kingdom of Nepal.
 It expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop in the future, too.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Honorary President of Socialist International
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Honorary President of Socialist International
    Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met Guy Spitaels, honorary president of Socialist International and former president of the Belgian Socialist Party (Wallon), and his party and had a friendly talk with them at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
 On hand were officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
